top_categories.workout_context: Tour de Gap's Mississippi rolling hills, Rural gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 65 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Tour de Gap's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before July.
Tour de Gap's Mississippi rolling hills gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
At Tour de Gap, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
65 miles on Mississippi rolling hills gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
When someone attacks on Mississippi rolling hills gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Tour de Gap. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Tour de Gap, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Varied gradients on Mississippi rolling hills gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on Mississippi rolling hills gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 3,000ft of climbing on Mississippi rolling hills gravel does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Tour de Gap’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Tour de Gap requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on mississippi rolling hills gravel to build confidence. Expect: mississippi rolling hills, rural gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 65 miles of mississippi rolling hills gravel in Fulton, Mississippi.
